### L2M-AID: Autonomous Cyber-Physical Defense by Fusing Semantic Reasoning of Large Language Models with Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning (Preprint)


üõ°Ô∏è **SECURITY ALERT**


The article "L2M-AID: Autonomous Cyber-Physical Defense by Fusing Semantic Reasoning of Large Language Models with Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning" introduces a novel approach to enhancing cybersecurity defenses by combining the semantic reasoning capabilities of large language models (LLMs) with the strategic decision-making of multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL). ### Opt Out October: Daily Tips to Protect Your Privacy and Security


üõ°Ô∏è **SECURITY ALERT**


Opt Out October is an initiative that provides daily tips throughout the month to help individuals enhance their privacy and security online. Each day, users receive practical advice on various aspects of digital safety, ranging from managing privacy settings on social media to securing personal devices and understanding data collection practices. The campaign emphasizes the importance of proactive measures in safeguarding personal information, empowering people to take control of their digital presence in an increasingly connected world. üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article "A taxonomy of Mac stealers: Distinguishing Atomic, Odyssey, and Poseidon" provides a detailed analysis of three prominent types of malware aimed at Mac systems, namely Atomic, Odyssey, and Poseidon. These malicious programs are designed to steal sensitive data from users, and the article elaborates on their distinct characteristics, methods of operation, and potential impact on users. ### When AI Remembers Too Much ‚Äì Persistent Behaviors in Agents‚Äô Memory


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The article, "When AI Remembers Too Much ‚Äì Persistent Behaviors in Agents‚Äô Memory," discusses the challenges and implications of AI systems that retain excessive information, leading to unintended persistent behaviors. These behaviors arise when AI models, particularly those employing reinforcement learning, continue to exhibit actions based on past experiences that may no longer be relevant or appropriate. The retention of outdated or irrelevant data can result in inefficiencies and errors, potentially impacting decision-making processes and user experiences. The article emphasizes the need for developing strategies

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/indirect-prompt-injection-poisons-ai-longterm-memory/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_3253)**
